author: Pat Deavoll
title: New hot pools for Tekapo
text:
New hot pools for Tekapo PAT DEAVOLL Last updated 17:32, August 31 2015 Supplied 
A couple enjoy a warm summers evening in the hot pool at Tekapo Springs. 
Tekapo Springs has announced it will open three new hot pools in time for Christmas, at the cost of $1 milion. 
The new facilities will include two children's splash pool areas, one of 80 square metres and another of 130 square metres, plus an adult's pool of 80 square metres. 
Tekapo Springs owner and managing director Karl Burtscher said he was "delighted" with the new additions, which are scheduled to open on December 26, 2015. Themed "high country tarns," each pool will have its own distinctive shade of aqua green. The adult pool will be 28 degrees celsius, significantly cooler than the current pools which are heated from 36C to 39C. "We are putting in a cooler pool due to public feedback," Burtscher said. "The plan is to run the new pools through the winter, depending on outside weather temperatures." Karl Burtscher 
An artists impression of the new children's play area planned for Tekapo Springs. 
The new pools will add to an attraction that includes three existing outdoor hot pools, a steam and sauna facility, ice rink, day spa, cafe and licensed bar. It also has the world's largest land-based inflatable slide. 
The new additions are stage two of a three stage development that will see individual private pools installed in about three years time. 
The complex can cater for 300 visitors at one time, and had 110,000 people through the doors in 2014. 
Burtscher said it was busier in winter, but he would like to attract more people in summer time, hence the cooler pool. 
"After all, that's when most of the tourists are around," he said.
